dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so Netflix, right? Everyone's been talking about the streaming wars, Disney+, Apple TV+, all that jazz.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so Netflix, right? Everyone's been talking about the streaming wars, Disney plus, Apple T V plus, all that jazz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, totally. And you’d think Netflix would be, like, sweating bullets, but apparently not!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, totally. And you'd think Netflix would be, like, sweating bullets, but apparently not!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! Reed Hastings, their CEO, uh, he's basically saying, "Bring it on." He even called these new competitors "world-class."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Reed Hastings, their C E O, uh, he's basically saying, Bring it on. He even called these new competitors world-class.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The big dog of Internet TV acknowledged the new competitors as world-class consumer brands whose forthcoming services would be a boon to consumers and content creators alike.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which is… interesting. You'd expect a bit more bravado, maybe? But then, their Q1 numbers just dropped, and wow, they added, what, 6.9 million subscribers?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is... interesting. You'd expect a bit more bravado, maybe? But then, their Q one numbers just dropped, and wow, they added, what, six point nine million subscribers?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix reported record 9.6 million subscribers in the quarter that ended in March.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a record! And most of that, like 7.16 million, came from *outside* the U.S., which is huge for their global strategy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a record! And most of that, like seven point one six million, came from outside the U S, which is huge for their global strategy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Much of that growth7.86 million subscriberscame outside the U.S.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, they're growing, but Hastings isn't just whistling in the dark. He's saying the "transition from linear to on-demand" is so massive, these new players won't affect their growth *materially*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they're growing, but Hastings isn't just whistling in the dark. He's saying the transition from linear to on-demand is so massive, these new players won't affect their growth materially.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We dont anticipate that these new entrants will materially affect our growth because the transition from linear to on-demand entertainment is so massive and because of the differing nature of our content offerings, Hastings wrote Tuesday in an investor letter that accompanied Netflix's first quarter earnings release.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And he pointed out that Netflix only accounts for about five percent of total TV usage in the U.S. – their most mature market. So there's, uh, just so much more room to grow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And he pointed out that Netflix only accounts for about five percent of total T V usage in the U S - their most mature market. So there's, uh, just so much more room to grow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Netflix represents only about 10% of total TV usage in the U.S., its most mature market, Hastings noted, and there's more room to grow around the world.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I hear that, but Disney+ is coming with Star Wars, Marvel, Pixar… that’s a pretty heavy hitter lineup. Are we sure Netflix isn't just, like, putting on a brave face?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I hear that, but Disney plus is coming with Star Wars, Marvel, Pixar... that's a pretty heavy hitter lineup. Are we sure Netflix isn't just, like, putting on a brave face?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The forthcoming service debuts in the U.S. on Nov. 12 with a strong roster of entertainment brands, including Star Wars, Pixar and Marvel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, Hastings also said there's ample appetite for great content, and Netflix only satisfies a portion of that demand. And let's not forget their own originals are crushing it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, Hastings also said there's ample appetite for great content, and Netflix only satisfies a portion of that demand. And let's not forget their own originals are crushing it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He argued that theres ample appetite for great movies and TV shows, and Netflix only satisfies a portion of that demand.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. "The Umbrella Academy" was massive, right? Like, 35 million households in its first month?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. The Umbrella Academy was massive, right? Like, thirty five million households in its first month?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Umbrella Academy, a series based on the comic book by Gerard Way and Gabriel Bá, which has been watched in 45 million households in its first four weeks on service, he said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. And "Triple Frontier" with Ben Affleck did, what, 5 million homes? So they're still pumping out hits.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. And Triple Frontier with Ben Affleck did, what, five million homes? So they're still pumping out hits.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Viewers in 52 million homes grabbed the popcorn to watch the action/heist movie Triple Frontier, starring Ben Affleck and directed by J.C. Chandor.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] And the international stuff! I saw they adapted "Nailed It!" for Mexico, France, Germany… and "Kingdom," their Korean zombie show, was a huge success.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the international stuff! I saw they adapted Nailed It! for Mexico, France, Germany... and Kingdom, their Korean zombie show, was a huge success.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is adapting its lighthearted cooking competition Nailed It! for Mexico, France, Germany and Spain. ... The service also premiered it first large scale Korean original series, Kingdom , in January. This period piece with zombies is our most successful season one show in Korea to date and has also been watched by millions of members outside of Korea, Hastings said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. That's Ted Sarandos' point, their Chief Content Officer. He said their business is all about "creating and telling great stories around the world that are exclusively on Netflix."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. That's Ted Sarandos' point, their Chief Content Officer. He said their business is all about creating and telling great stories around the world that are exclusively on Netflix.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The top 10 show are all Netflix original brands, said Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos. So increasingly our business is about creating and telling great stories around the world that are exclusively on Netflix.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So basically, Netflix's strategy isn't to *fight* the new competition, but to just keep doing what they're doing, uh, but better and more globally?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So basically, Netflix's strategy isn't to fight the new competition, but to just keep doing what they're doing, uh, but better and more globally?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. They see the pie expanding, not just getting carved up differently. It's a bold stance, but their numbers, you know, seem to back it up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. They see the pie expanding, not just getting carved up differently. It's a bold stance, but their numbers, you know, seem to back it up.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it'll be interesting to see how it all shakes out over the next year or two.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it'll be interesting to see how it all shakes out over the next year or two.
